title: For Sale:  1943 Russian Mosin Nagant 9130 sniper rifle with PU scope
postcontent:
For sale is my Russian sniper rifle which was a conversion that I made with the help of a machinist.  The Rifle itself is dated 1943 which was a perfect candidate for the PU scope which was made between 1942 and 1944.  Mine is an excellent reproduction out of Canada and features the three post retical as was used in that era.  The scope conversion came with a scope mount, bent bolt, hardware, leather lens cap covers and canvas scope cover. The gun has a steel butt plate and a rubber one I added.   This sale includes a bayonet, leather ammo pouch, scope cover, winter hat, Russian flag, magazine and gun case.  I also have ammunition for this rifle sold separately.  This is the gun from Enemy at the Gate.  Very cool piece of history.
BTW this was a very labor intensive conversion so save yourself the trouble and buy it already converted.  Also, I have a 357 Magnum revolver snub nose listed for $350.

title: For Sale:  C.A.I. GEORGIA VT PISTOL MODELP-64
postcontent:
USED CONDITION

The P-64 pistol (official designation 9 mm pistolet wz. 1964) has been developed in Poland during late 1950s and early 1960s, as a compact and lightweight replacement for Tokarev TT pistols, manufactured in Poland under soviet license. Following the Soviet road, Poland replaced the powerful 7.62x25mm ammunition with less powerful, but still effective 9x18 Makarov ammunition. P-64 has been used by both Polish military and police, and still could be found in holsters of some Polish police officers. In military service it has been superceded in mid-1980s by the P-83 pistol. The P-64 was small and light enough for a pocket or a concealed carry sidearm, but it has too small magazine, and too heavy trigger pull to be considered as a valuable service pistol. The severe felt recoil also did not helped to establish popularity for this gun.
P-64 is a blowback operated, semi-automatic weapon, made almost entirely of steel. P-64 is hammer fired, with double-action trigger and decocking safety, mounted at the left side of the slide. Safety features also include loaded chamber indicator in the form of a small pin, which protrudes from the back of the slide, above the hammer, when chamber is loaded with cartridge. Trigger guard is a separate unit, which is hinged to the frame and served as a disassembly lever when pulled down. Single stack magazine contains only 6 rounds, and magazine release catch is located at the bottom of the grip.

INVENTARY NUMBER: G1003750-1
SERIAL NUMBER: JRO7570

Type: Double Action 
Calibers: 9x18 Makarov 
Weight unloaded: 635 g 
Length: 155 mm 
Barrel length: 85 mm 
Capacity: 6 rounds

title: For Sale:  (2) Ruger 22 LR, Glock 23, Springfield XDS, & AR-15
postcontent:
NOT INTERESTED IN ANY CASH OFFERS UNLESS IT'S CLOSING THE GAP ON A PARTIAL TRADE... 

My personal guns for trade are as follows:

1. Mossy Oak Camo Ruger 10/22 Takedown with aftermarket "Kidd" bolt assembly & a threaded barrel with a screw on flash hider. Only interested in trading for another threaded barrel rifle. Value = $450

2. Ruger 22/45 pistol (22 LR) with a threaded barrel. (I will only trade this for another threaded barrel pistol). Value = $425

3. AR-15: (BCM upper with 18.5" barrel, and Noveski lower). Has full length Centurian Arms Quad Rail. Value = $1400 (stripped of all accessories)

4. Gen 4, Glock 23 (Compact .40 caliber). Value = $550

5. Springfield XDS .45 Auto. Value = $550 (POST RECALL, Springfield already upgraded it and gave it back with a few 7 round extended mags).

All 5 guns are in phenomenal shape both mechanically and asthetically. The only marks you may find on the Glock and the XDS would be a slight amount of "holster wear". That just means that they've been well loved :-) I meticulously clean them after every use.

The new legislation that Washington voters passed this month DISGUSTS ME! I love the guns that I currently own and I never intended on getting rid of them. HOWEVER, I don't feel that it's ANY of the governments business to know what I own. I believe we are only 1 vote away (maybe even as little as 1 term) from having to actually register what we already own. As it stands, after December we will have to go through an FFL to buy sell or trade our firearms.

The purpose of this ad is to possibly trade what I have with what you have before we are REQUIRED to leave a paper trail. It is my sincerest hope that we never have to register what we own but if we hope for the best it's not too late for our personal firearms to be "grandfathered in" to whatever legislation is to come.

I am MOST INTERESTED in swapping them for the EXACT same guns. If you have something else for trade I suppose I could entertain that thought as well. I do miss my 12 gage shotgun and I have always wanted a Ruger GP-100 mag or a .44 mag :-)

title: For Sale:  PSA Scammer alert: Selling 54r Vepr UPDATE 11/17
postcontent:
HE IS NOW USING A NEW IMAGE. The "MY VEPR 7.62X54R WITH IRONWOOD STOCK SET IS FOR SALE" listing is an image from a forum user in Washington.. Not Arizona. Reverse image search if you don't believe me. The user even stated that he ended up selling his AR instead of the vepr because he liked it so much.

This guy has posted about 6 different ads, in different locations across the states. Once in Ohio, Arizona (most recently), another somewhere further east, etc. Search all states > 54r > semi auto, you will find multiple ads, worded similarly.

He is selling under the current market price of what an actual 54r vepr would go for. He doesn't respond to any messages about possibly purchasing locally.

Also he has also posted on gunauction, the auctions untouched because the only payment option is money order, so good luck getting it after sending money.

example: http://www.gunauction.com/search/displayitem.cfm?itemnum=12777885

Please be careful, if something seems too good to be true it probably is.

Below are some of the wordings he used in some of his listings, as well as images.


"Here is my own collection selling due to financial difficulties only, Vepr 7.62x54r made in Russia in excellent cosmetic and working condition. This is Russian BULL heavy duty semi auto AK style rifle, 16.5 inch barrel."

"Here is my own collection selling due to financial difficulties only, Vepr 7.62x54r made in Russia in excellent cosmetic and working condition. This is Russian BULL heavy duty semi auto AK style rifle, 16.5 inch barrel. The rifle comes with 5 magazines, (3) 10 rounds and (2) 5 rounds, also comes with AK style sling, and professional PU scope with cover,cleaning rod, and cleaning tools (see pictures). The buyer will pay shipping cost $35.00"

rekt.

to the scammer: I will continue to follow you until you give up. You have my word.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Smith & Wesson .38 Spl revolver
postcontent:
For sale is a great Smith and Wesson revolver.  It is a Model 1905 Military & Police, 2nd change revolver in .38 Special, 4" barrel, 5 screw Sq butt, etc. Serial #740XX. Manufacture date would be 1906-1909. 

This is a solid, mechanically sound and smooth revolver. Unfortunately, the collectable quality has been removed by a previous owner who did an excellent job of fitting a full rib to the top of the barrel with the rear 2.75" or so rounded and tapered with a fine pebble finish to cut the glare. Then, almost as an afterthought, he slapped on a shotgun bead front and rough metal leaf fixed rear sight. On the plus side, the whole gun has been refinished and the action is very tight and smooth, grips are decent too. Overall it is a very good shooter.

Revolver shoots great, very smooth and with 148 gr wadcutters hits POA at about 15 yards. Being a pre-numbered model, +P ammo is a no-no. 

Can include a bunch of .38 spl full wadcutter low powered plinking ammo for $15/50.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Kel-Tec KSG FDE LNIB +Bag, Sights, FVG
postcontent:
The KSG (Kel-Tec Shotgun) is Kel-Tec CNC’s first entry into the shotgun market. The size, shape, and design is similar to the currently available Kel-Tec RFB rifle, but the KSG ejects downward, instead of forward. The KSG weighs 6.9 lbs. and is as compact as legally possible with a 26.1” overall length and an 18.5” cylinder bore barrel. Even with this compact size, the internal dual tube magazines hold an impressive 12 rounds of 12 gauge 3” rounds in total (6 per tube). It can also reliably shoot shells as short as 1 3/4" up to the 3".
This simple and reliable pump action feeds from either the left or right tube. The feed side is manually selected by a lever located behind the trigger guard.

The pump includes an under picatinny rail for the mounting of a forward grip, a light, or a laser. The included top picatinny sight rail will accept many types of optics or iron sights. Forward and rear sling loops are built in, and a basic sling is included. The soft rubber butt pad helps to tame recoil.

The KSG receiver is made from hardened steel and includes the magazine tubes which have been welded in place. The grip and stock assembly is made of glass reinforced nylon (Zytel) and is easily disassembled by pushing out 2 pins, which store in 2 holes in the grip when removed. The barrel and pump assembly is removed by loosening the 2 front magazine tube nuts with a coin and sliding the assembly forward.

KSG has less than 100 rounds through it and has had no problems. Zero FTF, FTE or anything. This is a Gen 2 after they fixed those issues. All accesories Magpul, FVG, rear and front flip up sights. 
Voodo Tactical shotgun bag.

title: For Sale:  ENVIS Monocular Gen3
postcontent:
I got a night vision monocular for sale, NO TRADES. $1200 OBO. It is used but well taken care of. I used it as a second NVG during my time as a Soldier and also when I would go Hog Hunting. Don't need it anymore so I'm selling it. They go for $2000 to $2500 new. Here is a description of the monocular:
ENVIS (Evader’s Night Vision Imaging System) is a rugged handheld night vision system for operators who must be prepared for covert night movement. Night movement is the best choice for evasive movement, but it is generally discouraged because of difficulty navigating in the dark. The ENVIS is the survival tool of choice, designed specifically to overcome obstacles and hazards when moving at night and successfully evade hostile territory. The ENVIS is USAF approved for flight survival vests. It is a lightweight night vision pocketscope that fits in one hand for direct viewing. It can easily convert a standard still or video camera into a high quality night vision recording device. It attaches to the objective lens threads of most cameras for temporary nighttime applications. title: For Sale/Trade:  PPK/S .22
postcontent: The appearance of the PPK/S .22 is striking – it’s a very handsome pistol right out of the box, and fit and finish are excellent.  The gun is tight without any slide play or rattles. title: For Sale:  Noveske / Silencerco Saker Lower - Limited Edition Lower Receiver
postcontent:
This is for the stripped lower receiver only - as received directly from SilencerCo - it has never been assembled or anything, just been sitting in the bag that I received it in. 

If you're viewing this listing, I'm guessing you know all about it - a limited run of Noveske made lower receivers, with SilencerCo on one side, and Noveske on the other side. These were made by Noveske for SilencerCo and offered during a very small window restricted to people that purchased a SilencerCo Saker suppressor during that window. 

You know about Noveske, and whenever they do limited runs on things (especially lower receivers) people go crazy for them. I've hung onto this for awhile, debating whether to use it for a nice build or not - but I've decided to go ahead and sell it instead. In no hurry to sell it, as it's a pretty niche item - and not just your regular ol' everyday lower receiver. I've seen them go for $600, but I wouldn't feel good selling it that expensive - having said that, I know the right buyer is willing to shell out for this limited run item.

A lower receiver is considered a 'firearm' and therefore will need to ship FFL -> FFL. Free shipping.

(photos are from http://www.silencershop.com/ but the pictured receiver is identical to mine)

Make me an offer.

title: For Sale:  30 Caliber Ammocans Storage Geocache Prepper
postcontent:
==========================================================================
ATTENTION
==========================================================================
If you're interesting in responding to this listing, please read carefully. I will consider all correspondence
to me as SPAM and will not respond unless you do the following in your email..

- In your email to me, in additional to the Item Listed, in big, upper case letters, type: SERIOUS BUYER
- and include your name and phone number within the body of the email.
==========================================================================

I have for sale military surplus .30 ammocans for sale. They are Condition: Grade 2/Very Good (Grade 1 is new).

These GENUINE military cans have many uses including storage, geocaching, tool boxes, and of course, they can be used to store your ammo. They have a rubber seal on the lid that makes them virtually air tight and highly water resistant. This can also makes a great camera box on float trips. 30 cal. cans measure 10"L x 3 1/2"W x 6 3/4"D on the inside.

Don't be fooled by those new ammocans sold at Gander Mountain, Fleet Farm, Cabelas, Walmart, etc. Those ammocans are NOT considered MILSPEC and do not have the same gasket and sealing mechanism as the military models do.

Priced as follows:

$10 each if paid in cash.
$10.45 each if paid via Paypal.

Buy just one or one hundred. I'll likely have as many as you'll need.

If you live outside the Twin Cities metropolitan area, I can ship two ammocans in a USPS fixed rate box for a shipping fee of $13. If you need more than two, we'll use custom packaging and you'd pay actual shipping costs.

30 .30 caliber M19A1 ammocan ammo can prepper prepping geocaching geocache storage zombie
